column3: Julia's grandmother died recently {{c1::at}} the age of 82.
When I was 14, I went {{c1::on}} a trip to France organised by my school.
Can you turn the light on, please? I don't want to sit {{c1::in}} the dark.
I hate driving {{c1::in}} fog. You can't see anything.
We didn't go {{c1::on}} holiday last year. We stayed at home.
Alan got married {{c1::at}} 18, which is rather young to get married.
I heard an interesting programme {{c1::on}} the radio this morning.
What should I do, {{c1::in}} your opinion?
I wouldn't like to go {{c1::on}} a cruise. I think I'd get bored.
I shouldn't eat too much. I'm supposed to be {{c1::on}} a diet.
The earth travels round the sun {{c1::at}} 107,000 kilometres an hour.
I wouldn't like to do his job. He spends most of his time {{c1::on}} the phone.
A lot of houses were damaged {{c1::in}} the storm last week.
I feel lazy this evening. Is there anything to watch {{c1::on}} TV?
I didn't enjoy every minute of the holiday, but {{c1::on}} the whole it was good.
